thread.title: Germaine De Randamie beats Holly Holm at UFC 208
thread.title_full: Germaine De Randamie beats Holly Holm at UFC 208 | Daily Mail Online

author: Peter Carroll For Mailonline
title: Germaine De Randamie beats Holly Holm at UFC 208
text:
Boos rang out around the Barclays Centre in Brooklyn as Germaine De Randamie became the first UFC women's featherweight champion after five rounds of action with Holly Holm in the main event of UFC 208.
De Randamie countered well with her powerful right hand in the first and second rounds but appeared to hit former bantamweight champion Holm after the bell at the end of the second.
Again, after Holm appeared to hurt her with a head kick, the Muay Thai champion cracked her opponent after the bell sounded to finish the third round.
Germaine de Randamie (right) celebrates her victory over Holly Holm at UFC 208
De Randamie raises her arms after claiming the women's featherweight championship
Holm looks dejected after her controversial defeat at the Barclays Centre in Brooklyn
UFC 208 RESULTS Germaine de Randamie defeated Holly Holm via unanimous decision
Anderson Silva defeated Derek Brunson via unanimous decision
Ronaldo Souza defeated Tim Boetsch via submission (kimura)
Glover Teixeira defeated Jared Cannonier via unanimous decision
Dustin Poirier defeated Jim Miller via majority decision
Belal Muhammad defeated Randy Brown via unanimous decision
Wilson Reis defeated Ulka Sasaki via unanimous decision
Islam Makhachev defeated Nik Lentz via unanimous decision
Rick Glenn defeated Phillipe Nover via split decision
Ryan LaFlare defeated Roan Carneiro via unanimous decision
Despite wobbling back to her corner ahead of the third round, Holm slowed De Randamie with some clinch work against the fence in the fourth. Ending on a strong note, De Randamie looked visibly shaken after eating a short left hand in the fifth round.
In her post-fight interview, De Randamie insisted that the shots after the bell were unintentional.
'It was in the heat of the moment,' said De Randamie, commenting on the shots after the bell at the end of the second and third rounds.
'I apologised. Even the referee told me that, the first time, the shot was on the bell. It wasn't meant for me to hit her after the bell. It was in the heat of the moment. I apologise - I'm not like that.'
A woman who many believe is the sole reason UFC rolled out the women's featherweight division, Cris 'Cyborg' Justino, was Octagon-side on the night, but De Randamie insisted their meeting would have to wait until after she underwent surgery for damaged ligaments in her hand.
De Randamie won in controversial circumstances after five rounds of the main event
The Dutchwoman twice appeared to hit Holm after the bell had sounded in Brooklyn
She said: 'I want to fight everybody and Cris 'Cyborg' is one the people I will have to fight, so I will fight her. Right now, I really need to get surgery on my hand. We'll see after.'
Anderson Silva was overcome with emotion when he claimed his first victory since October 2012 over Derek Brunson in a tentative three-round bout.
The former middleweight champion appeared to offer no defence to Brunson's uppercuts from inside the clinch at the end of the first round following a wheel kick attempt.
In the second, Silva scored big with a body kick after luring Brunson into a trance with a capoeira set-up. Despite Brunson taking him down in the third, Silva jerked his opponent's head back on a number of occasions with his jab.
De Randamie insisted that the shots after the bell were unintentional following the bout
De Randamie punches out at Holm as the American aims a kick at her opponent
De Randamie aims a right hook towards Holm's head as she earns a controversial win
Many felt that the decision should have been in Brunson's favour due to the large spells of inactivity Silva displayed over the 15 minutes.
Brazilian jiu-jitsu legend Ronaldo 'Jacare' Souza demanded a middleweight title shot after a quick submission victory over Tim Boetsch on the night.
The match-up seemed unnecessary due to the disparity in the duo's standing in the division, but Souza's quick transition from mount into a kimura left no doubts as to who was the elite contender of the two.
Souza's only loss in the UFC came against Yoel Romero, who is currently seeking a showdown with middleweight champion Michael Bisping, in an excruciatingly close contest at UFC 194.
Glover Teixeira showcased his grappling prowess against Jared Cannonier to claim a unanimous decision win, after getting rocked in the first round by the heavy underdog.
Anderson Silva (right) claimed a controversial win over Derek Brunson on the undercard
Ronaldo 'Jacare' Souza (right) called for a title showdown after defeating Tim Boetsch
Speaking after the victory, the Brazilian claimed that he wanted to get back in position to face the biggest names in the division—champion Daniel Cormier, Anthony 'Rumble' Johnson, Jon Jones—having suffered a first round KO at the hands of Johnson back in August.
Dustin Poirier had to fight on a severely damaged right leg due to Jim Miller's leg kick offence in the main event curtain raiser.
When the limb became tender, Poirier forced the action to the ground in the third round, which proved to be pivotal as he reintroduced himself to the win column after his knockout loss to Michael Johnson with a majority decision victory.
